# undoManager

**Instance Property**

Returns the nearest shared undo manager in the responder chain.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var undoManager: UndoManager? { get }
```

## Discussion

By default, every window of an application has an undo manager: a shared object for managing undo and redo operations. However, the class of any object in the responder chain can have their own custom undo manager. (For example, instances of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextField] have their own undo manager that’s cleared when the text field resigns first-responder status.) When you request an undo manager, the request goes up the responder chain and the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIWindow] object returns a usable instance.

You may add undo managers to your view controllers to perform undo and redo operations local to the managed view.
